contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Officeholder | honorific-prefix = The Right Hon. | name = George Perry Graham | honorific-suffix = | smallimage = George Perry Graham.jpg | imagesize = | office = [[Senate of Canada|Senator]] for Eganville, Ontario | appointed = [[William Lyon Mackenzie King]] | term_start = 1926 | term_end = 1943 | constituency_MP2 = [[Essex South]] | parliament2 = Canadian | predecessor2 = [[John Wesley Brien]] | successor2 = [[Eccles James Gott]] | term_start2 = 1921 | term_end2 = 1925 | constituency_MP3 = [[Renfrew South]] | parliament3 = Canadian | predecessor3 = [[Thomas Andrew Low]] | successor3 = [[Isaac Ellis Pedlow]] | term_start3 = 1912 | term_end3 = 1917 | constituency_MP4 = [[Brockville (electoral district)|Brockville]] | parliament4 = Canadian | predecessor4 = [[Daniel Derbyshire]] | successor4 = [[John Webster (Canadian politician)|John Webster]] | term_start4 = 1907 | term_end4 = 1911 | office5 = Member of the [[Legislative Assembly of Ontario]] for Brockville | predecessor5 = [[George Augustus Dana]] | successor5 = [[Albert Edward Donovan]] | term_start5 = 1898 | term_end5 = 1908 | birth_date = {{birth date|1859|03|31}} | birth_place = Eganville, Canada West | death_date = {{death date and age|1943|01|01|1859|03|31}} | death_place = | nationality = | spouse = | party = [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal]] | otherparty = [[Ontario Liberal Party]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | religion = }} '''George Perry Graham''', [[Queen's Privy Council for Canada|PC]] (31 March 1859 – 1 January 1943) was a journalist, editor and politician in [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]. In the [[Ontario general election, 1898|1898 Ontario provincial election]], he was elected to the [[Legislative Assembly of Ontario]], and re-elected in 1902 and 1905. In 1904, he was appointed to the [[Cabinet (government)|cabinet]] as [[Provincial Secretary]] by [[Premier]] [[George William Ross]] and served in that position until the Ross government lost the [[Ontario general election, 1905|election of 1905]]. When Ross resigned as leader of the [[Ontario Liberal Party]] in 1907, Graham briefly succeeded him, but quickly left later that year for federal politics when he was appointed Minister of Railway and Canals in the [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal]] government of Sir [[Wilfrid Laurier]]. Ross won a seat in the [[Canadian House of Commons]] in a [[by-election]] in 1907. He was defeated in the [[Canadian federal election, 1911|1911 federal election]] that brought [[Robert Borden]]'s [[Conservative Party of Canada (historical)|Conservatives]] to power, but returned to the House of Commons in a 1912 by-election. In 1921, he served in a number of defence portfolios in the Cabinet of [[William Lyon Mackenzie King]]. He lost his seat in the [[Canadian federal election, 1925|1925 federal election]], but was appointed to the [[Canadian Senate]] in 1926, and sat in that body until his death in 1943. == References == * {{CanParlbio|ID=d37caeac-e2c8-4010-a406-bd6c910d1265}} * {{OntarioMPPbio|ID=1219}} ==See also== *[[:Category:Canadian journalists|Canadian journalists]] *[[Politics of Canada]] {{s-start}} {{s-ppo}} {{succession box| before=Sir [[George William Ross]]| title=[[Ontario Liberal Party|Leader of the Ontario Liberal Party]]| years=1907| after=[[Alexander Grant MacKay]] }} {{s-end}} {{CA-Ministers of Defence}} {{CA-Ministers of Transport}} {{Ontario Liberal Leaders}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Graham, George Perry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 31 March 1859 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Eganville, Canada West | DATE OF DEATH = 1 January 1943 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Graham, George Perry}} [[Category:1859 births]] [[Category:1943 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian Ministers of Railways and Canals]] [[Category:Canadian senators from Ontario]] [[Category:Liberal Party of Canada MPs]] [[Category:Liberal Party of Canada senators]] [[Category:Ontario Liberal Party MPPs]] [[Category:Leaders of the Ontario Liberal Party]] [[Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Ontario]] [[Category:Members of the Queen's Privy Council for Canada]] [[Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Liberal Party of Canada leadership candidates]] {{Liberal-Ontario-MP-stub}} {{Liberal-Ontario-MPP-stub}}
